alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 20 at 4:14PM MDT until August 20 at 7:15PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... South Central Wayne County in southern Utah... * Until 715 PM MDT. * At 414 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across Capitol Reef National Park. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Capitol Reef National Park and Fruita. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
